name: df-zn
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(czn, cmpt(s0, cn0, csb(s1, zring, csb(s2, co(cv(s1), cqus, co(cv(s1), cqg, cfv(cfv(crsp, cv(s1)), csn(cv(s0))))), co(cv(s2), csts, cop(cfv(cple, cnx), csb(s3, cres(cfv(czrh, cv(s2)), cif(cz, co(nat0, cfzo, cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), nat0))), ccom(ccom(cv(s3), cle), ccnv(cv(s3))))))))))
comment: Define the ring of integers ` mod n ` . This is literally the quotient ring of ` ZZ ` by the ideal ` n ZZ ` , but we augment it with a total order. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Jun-2015.) (Revised by AV, 12-Jun-2019.)
